intro: Dorema kopetdaghense, commonly known as the Kopetdagh bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in the Kopetdagh region of Turkmenistan and Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Dorema kopetdaghense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
